steps.title: Renew Intention & Learn Your Route
variantNotes: Perform Hajj as Tamattu', Qiran, or Ifrad according to your group plan.
If you are unsure, follow your group scholar's exact sequencing.
checklist: Keep emergency contacts and camp info
steps.instructions: Review your Hajj type, group schedule, and safety instructions. Keep your intention sincere and avoid arguments or distractions.

duas.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أُرِيدُ الْحَجَّ فَيَسِّرْهُ لِي وَتَقَبَّلْهُ مِنِّي
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni ureedul-hajja fayassirhu li wa taqabbalhu minni.
duas.translation: O Allah, I intend Hajj, so make it easy for me and accept it from me.
duas.note: State intention clearly and proceed with your group plan.

steps.title: Enter Ihram for Hajj
variantNotes: Tamattu': enter fresh Ihram for Hajj on 8th.
Qiran/Ifrad: many pilgrims remain in Ihram from earlier.
steps.instructions: Perform ghusl, wear Ihram garments, and make intention for Hajj before departure to Mina.

duas.arabic: لَبَّيْكَ اللَّهُمَّ حَجًّا
duas.translation: Here I am, O Allah, for Hajj.

duas.arabic: لَبَّيْكَ اللَّهُمَّ لَبَّيْكَ، لَبَّيْكَ لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ لَبَّيْكَ، إِنَّ الْحَمْدَ وَالنِّعْمَةَ لَكَ وَالْمُلْكَ لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ
duas.transliteration: Labbayk Allahumma Labbayk. Labbayk la shareeka laka Labbayk. Innal-hamda wan-ni'mata laka wal-mulk. La shareeka lak.
duas.translation: Here I am, O Allah, here I am. You have no partner. Truly all praise, favor, and dominion belong to You.

steps.title: Prepare Essentials for Mina/Arafah
variantNotes: Keep medicines and hydration salts with you.
Use lightweight bag and avoid unnecessary items.
steps.instructions: Pack only essentials and prepare for intense heat and crowd conditions.

duas.arabic: حَسْبُنَا اللَّهُ وَنِعْمَ الْوَكِيلُ
duas.translation: Allah is sufficient for us, and He is the best disposer of affairs.

steps.title: Night Before Hajj: Dhikr & Rest
variantNotes: Avoid long late-night activity to preserve energy.
Prioritize Fajr readiness and group departure timing.
steps.instructions: Rest well and keep your tongue busy with Talbiyah and istighfar.

duas.arabic: أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ
duas.translation: I seek Allah's forgiveness and repent to Him.

steps.title: Depart to Mina
variantNotes: Remain patient in transport delays and congestion.
Keep Talbiyah frequent throughout movement.
steps.instructions: Travel to Mina after sunrise while reciting Talbiyah.

duas.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَى اللَّهِ، وَلَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ
duas.transliteration: Bismillahi tawakkaltu 'ala Allah, wa la hawla wa la quwwata illa billah.
duas.translation: In the name of Allah, I rely upon Allah; there is no power except with Allah.

steps.title: Pray in Mina (Dhuhr to Fajr)
steps.titleAr: صلوات منى من الظهر إلى الفجر
variantNotes: Four-rakah prayers are shortened to two (except Maghrib).
Prayers are prayed separately, not combined, in Mina.
checklist: Prepare for early departure to Arafah
steps.instructions: Pray Dhuhr, Asr, Maghrib, Isha and Fajr in Mina according to Sunnah practice.

duas.arabic: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ
duas.translation: Glory be to Allah, praise be to Allah, and Allah is the Greatest.

steps.title: Overnight in Mina
variantNotes: Rest is part of Sunnah preparation for Arafah.
Minimize unnecessary movement at night.
checklist: Keep pebbles plan for later days
steps.instructions: Spend the night in Mina and prepare physically and spiritually for Arafah.

duas.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ بِاسْمِكَ أَمُوتُ وَأَحْيَا
duas.translation: O Allah, in Your name I die and I live.

steps.title: Move from Mina to Arafah
variantNotes: Ensure you stay within Arafah boundaries before sunset.
Keep Talbiyah and avoid idle talk.
steps.instructions: Proceed to Arafah and settle in your designated area before Dhuhr.

duas.arabic: لَبَّيْكَ اللَّهُمَّ لَبَّيْكَ، لَبَّيْكَ لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ لَبَّيْكَ
duas.transliteration: Labbayk Allahumma Labbayk, Labbayk la shareeka laka Labbayk.
duas.translation: Here I am, O Allah, here I am. You have no partner.

steps.title: Combined Dhuhr and Asr at Arafah
variantNotes: Pray Dhuhr and Asr combined and shortened.
Listen to khutbah if available in your camp.
checklist: Start focused dua immediately after prayer
steps.instructions: After midday, pray Dhuhr and Asr together as performed in Hajj.

duas.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ أَعِنِّي عَلَى ذِكْرِكَ وَشُكْرِكَ وَحُسْنِ عِبَادَتِكَ
duas.transliteration: Allahumma a'inni 'ala dhikrika wa shukrika wa husni 'ibadatik.
duas.translation: O Allah, help me remember You, thank You, and worship You well.

steps.title: Wuquf: Main Standing of Hajj
variantNotes: This is the pillar of Hajj: 'Hajj is Arafah'.
Face Qiblah, raise hands, and make long dua.
steps.instructions: Spend this period in deep dua, istighfar, and dhikr until sunset.

duas.arabic: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
duas.transliteration: La ilaha illAllahu wahdahu la shareeka lah, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamd wa huwa 'ala kulli shay'in qadeer.
duas.translation: There is no god but Allah alone, without partner. His is dominion and praise, and He has power over all things.

duas.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّكَ عَفُوٌّ تُحِبُّ الْعَفْوَ فَاعْفُ عَنِّي
duas.translation: O Allah, You are Pardoning and love pardon, so pardon me.

steps.title: Move to Muzdalifah, Pray and Rest
variantNotes: Do not pray Maghrib before arriving at Muzdalifah.
Collect pebbles for Rami (typically 49 or 70 total for plan).
steps.instructions: After sunset, depart Arafah for Muzdalifah, combine Maghrib and Isha, and spend the night there.

duas.arabic: فَاذْكُرُوا اللَّهَ عِنْدَ الْمَشْعَرِ الْحَرَامِ
duas.translation: Remember Allah at al-Mash'ar al-Haram.

steps.title: Fajr and Dhikr at Muzdalifah
variantNotes: After Fajr, make dhikr until brightness before moving.
Weak pilgrims may move earlier according to scholars.
steps.instructions: Pray Fajr early, make dhikr, then depart to Mina before sunrise.

duas.arabic: رَبَّنَا آتِنَا فِي الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وَفِي الْآخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً وَقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana atina fid-dunya hasanah wa fil-akhirati hasanah wa qina 'adhaban-nar.
duas.translation: Our Lord, grant us good in this world and good in the Hereafter and protect us from the Fire.

steps.title: Rami of Jamarat al-Aqabah (7 Pebbles)
variantNotes: Only the large Jamrah is stoned on 10th.
Talbiyah stops before beginning this Rami.
steps.instructions: Stone Jamarat al-Aqabah with seven pebbles while saying takbeer each throw.

duas.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ، اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ
duas.translation: In the name of Allah, Allah is the Greatest.

steps.title: Qurbani / Hady
variantNotes: Tamattu' and Qiran require hady.
Ifrad does not require hady unless voluntary.
steps.instructions: Perform or delegate sacrifice according to your Hajj type.

duas.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ، اللَّهُمَّ هَذَا مِنْكَ وَلَكَ
duas.transliteration: Bismillahi wallahu Akbar, Allahumma hadha minka wa laka.
duas.translation: In the name of Allah, Allah is the Greatest. O Allah, this is from You and for You.

steps.title: Halq/Taqsir (Hair)
variantNotes: Men: shaving is more virtuous; trimming valid.
Women: trim fingertip-length only.
steps.instructions: Complete hair removal/trimming to enter first release from Ihram.

duas.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِلْمُحَلِّقِينَ
duas.translation: O Allah, forgive those who shave (their heads).

steps.title: Tawaf al-Ifadah
variantNotes: A pillar of Hajj; cannot be omitted.
No idtiba/raml required as in initial Umrah tawaf.
steps.instructions: Perform seven circuits of Tawaf al-Ifadah and pray two rakah.

duas.arabic: رَبَّنَا آتِنَا فِي الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وَفِي الْآخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً وَقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ
duas.transliteration: Rabbana atina fid-dunya hasanah wa fil-akhirati hasanah wa qina 'adhaban-nar.
duas.translation: Our Lord, grant us good in this world and in the Hereafter, and save us from the Fire.

steps.title: Sa'i (If Required)
variantNotes: Tamattu': Sa'i required now.
Qiran/Ifrad: if Sa'i was done with Tawaf al-Qudum, may not repeat.
checklist: Confirm with scholar if Sa'i is due
steps.instructions: Perform Sa'i if due for your Hajj type, then return to Mina.

duas.arabic: رَبِّ اغْفِرْ وَارْحَمْ وَأَنْتَ الْأَعَزُّ الْأَكْرَمُ
duas.translation: My Lord, forgive and have mercy; You are the Mightiest, Most Noble.

date: 11th Dhul Hijjah - First Day of Tashreeq
title: Day 4: Tashreeq Day 1

steps.title: Remain in Mina and Prepare for Rami
variantNotes: Use cooler time windows for movement.
Avoid exiting before fulfilling required rites.
steps.instructions: Stay in Mina and prepare calmly for post-Dhuhr stoning.

duas.arabic: اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ
duas.transliteration: Allahu Akbar Allahu Akbar la ilaha illAllah wallahu Akbar.
duas.translation: Allah is the Greatest. There is no god but Allah. Allah is the Greatest.

steps.title: Rami: Small, Middle, and Large Jamarat
variantNotes: Order matters: Small -> Middle -> Large.
After small and middle, stand aside for dua.
steps.instructions: Stone all three Jamarat in order with seven pebbles each.

duas.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ، اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ
duas.translation: In the name of Allah, Allah is the Greatest.

steps.title: Overnight in Mina
variantNotes: Overnight stay is required for most pilgrims.
Prepare for next day's Rami and possible early departure.
steps.instructions: Spend the night in Mina after completing stoning.

duas.arabic: رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَتُبْ عَلَيَّ
duas.translation: My Lord, forgive me and accept my repentance.

date: 12th Dhul Hijjah - Second Day of Tashreeq
title: Day 5: Tashreeq Day 2

steps.title: Repeat Rami of All Three Jamarat
variantNotes: Same order: Small -> Middle -> Large.
Maintain safety and avoid peak compression points.
steps.instructions: Perform stoning again in correct order after Dhuhr.

duas.arabic: اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ
duas.translation: Allah is the Greatest.

steps.title: Option A: Early Departure (Nafr al-Awwal)
variantNotes: If you leave Mina before sunset, day 6 stoning is waived.
If delayed past sunset, continue to 13th and perform next Rami.
steps.instructions: You may depart Mina before Maghrib after completing today's Rami.

duas.arabic: وَمَا تَوْفِيقِي إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ
duas.translation: My success is only through Allah.

steps.title: Option B: Stay for 13th (Nafr al-Thani)
steps.titleAr: الخيار ب: البقاء لليوم الثالث عشر
variantNotes: Staying is valid and often easier logistically for some groups.
You must perform Rami again on 13th.
steps.instructions: If you remain in Mina beyond sunset, complete next day's stoning as required.

duas.arabic: رَبَّنَا أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًا
duas.translation: Our Lord, pour upon us patience.

date: 13th Dhul Hijjah - Third Day (Optional for some)
title: Day 6: Final Mina Rami (If Staying)
titleAr: اليوم السادس: الرمي الأخير لمن بقي

steps.title: Final Rami of Three Jamarat
variantNotes: Applicable for pilgrims who remained in Mina.
Complete order and counts exactly as prior days.
steps.instructions: Stone all three Jamarat in order, then finalize your Mina obligations.

duas.arabic: اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ
duas.translation: Allah is the Greatest.

steps.title: Depart Mina to Makkah
variantNotes: Verify pending rites before leaving Mina.
Coordinate departure timing with your group leader.
steps.instructions: Leave Mina after fulfilling required stoning and proceed to Makkah.

duas.arabic: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي بِنِعْمَتِهِ تَتِمُّ الصَّالِحَاتُ
duas.translation: Praise be to Allah by whose favor righteous deeds are completed.

steps.title: Prepare for Tawaf al-Wada
variantNotes: Must be your final act in Makkah for most pilgrims.
Menstruating women are exempt according to Sunnah.
steps.instructions: Plan your departure so Tawaf al-Wada is your last major act in Makkah.

duas.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ يَسِّرْ لِي طَوَافَ الْوَدَاعِ وَتَقَبَّلْهُ مِنِّي
duas.transliteration: Allahumma yassir li tawafal-wada' wa taqabbalhu minni.
duas.translation: O Allah, make the farewell tawaf easy for me and accept it from me.

steps.title: Perform Tawaf al-Wada and Depart
variantNotes: Seven circuits, then two rakah if possible.
No long delay in Makkah after completion.
steps.instructions: Complete farewell tawaf, make heartfelt dua, and depart Makkah.

duas.arabic: رَبَّنَا تَقَبَّلْ مِنَّا إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
duas.translation: Our Lord, accept from us; You are the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
